contextId.occurrenceNote: Bathsheba speaks to David as if she were someone else to show that she respects David. Alternate translation: "to me, your servant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])

Bathsheba speaks to King David as if she were speaking about him to show that she respects him. Alternate translation: "when you sleep with your fathers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
contextId.glQuote: when my master the king sleeps with his fathers

contextId.occurrenceNote: David speaks of himself as if he were speaking of someone else so Zadok, Nathan, and Benaiah would remember that David is still king. Alternate translation: "my servants" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])

Benaiah speaks to King David as if he were speaking to someone else to show that he respects King David. Alternate translation: "My master and king, may Yahweh your God confirm" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
contextId.glQuote: May Yahweh, the God of my master the king, confirm

contextId.occurrenceNote: Benaiah speaks to King David as if he were speaking to someone else to show that he respects King David. Alternate translation: "has been with you, my master the king, so" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
contextId.glQuote: has been with my master the king, so

contextId.occurrenceNote: Benaiah speaks to King David as if he were speaking to someone else to show that he respects King David. Alternate translation: "your throne, my master King David" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
contextId.glQuote: the throne of my master King David

contextId.occurrenceNote: The servants speak to King Solomon as if they were speaking of someone else to show that they respected King Solomon. Alternate translation: "is afraid of you, King Solomon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])

Adonijah speaks of himself as if he were speaking of another person so people will think that he respects King Solomon. Alternate translation: "he will not kill me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
contextId.glQuote: he will not kill his servant

contextId.occurrenceNote: Solomon speaks as if he is another person to show respect to Yahweh. Alternate translation: "me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
The woman speaks as if she were speaking of someone else to show that she respects Solomon. Alternate translation: "I" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-pronouns]])
